content:
周末音乐节是在赫尔辛基举办的音乐节，之前也在斯德哥尔摩和派尔努举办。节被组织为在Luukki，埃斯波第一时间（大约从中心25公里赫尔辛基），芬兰于2012年8月的17和18在2013年节位置在Kyläsaari改变其旧的位置/赫尔辛基的卡拉萨塔马。2018 年，音乐节也搬到了赫尔辛基的 Hietaniemi。周末音乐节艺人阵容主要由EDM艺人组成，但也有其他音乐流派的艺人出席。这两年都有超过 40,000 人参加了这个节日。每年的节日都有不同的主题，主要体现在节日的视觉方面。2013 年的节日主题是 Space and Future，而 2014 年的组织者决定采用 Electro Disco 的主题。音乐节阵容有包括Skrillex、David Guetta、Calvin Harris、Martin Garrix 等在内的多位国际知名艺术家以及芬兰本土的流行艺术家。这两年的周末节都提前售罄。2013 年周末音乐节被芬兰广播电台 YleX 的听众票选为最佳夏季音乐节。在2015年，周末音乐节扩大到派尔努，爱沙尼亚并于 2016 年前往瑞典。

 

音乐节举办地

第一个周末音乐节发生在Luukki，埃斯波于2012年 Luukki娱乐区位于23公里从中央赫尔辛基，芬兰。Luukki 是赫尔辛基地区最受欢迎的户外休闲区之一，其中心地带是一座古老的庄园。该地区包括 20 公顷的松鼠栖息的森林。节日区设有三个舞台：NRJ 舞台、周末舞台和派对舞台。还有一个露营区。

 

由于 2012 年的交通困难，该节日于 2013 年从绿色的 Luukki 森林转移到更加城市化的 Kyläsaari/Kalasatama 节日区。 Kyläsaari/Kalasatama 的节日区距离赫尔辛基火车站仅 4 站地铁路程，也可轻松抵达公共汽车、自行车或步行。Kalasatama Festival 地区曾举办过各种大型音乐会和节日，包括Sonisphere 2011、Foo Fighters和Green Day。Weekend Festival 2013有四个阶段：NRJ Stage、Weekend Stage（帐篷）、Future Stage和Galaxy Stage。Future Stage 位于 Kyläsaari 港口。Kyläsaari 的节日区没有露营地。

 

2015 年，周末波罗的海音乐节也在爱沙尼亚 Pärnu 海滩举行，分为三个阶段。爱沙尼亚的最后一个音乐节于 2018 年举行。 2019 年 2 月 27 日，爱沙尼亚音乐节的主办方波罗的海周末音乐节宣布破产。

 

2018 年，该节日搬到了 Hietaniemi 海滩，并扩展为为期 3 天的节日。

 

2020 年，由于冠状病毒大流行，原计划在赫尔辛基 Käpylä 体育公园举办的 2020 年周末节被取消。
contentEn:
Weekend Festival is a music festival taking place in Helsinki, previously also in Stockholm and Pärnu. The festival was organised for the first time in Luukki, Espoo (about 25 km from the centre of Helsinki), Finland on the 17 and 18 of August 2012.[1] In 2013 the festival location was changed to its old location at Kyläsaari/Kalasatama in Helsinki. In 2018 the festival moved to Hietaniemi also in Helsinki. Weekend Festival artist line up has mainly consisted of EDM artists but there have also been artists from other music genres present.[2] The festival has been attended by more than 40,000 people on both years. Every year the festival has a different theme which reflects mainly in the visual side of the festival. In 2013 the festival theme was Space and Future while for 2014 the organisers decided to go with Electro Disco theme. The festival lineup has featured various internationally acclaimed artists including Skrillex, David Guetta, Calvin Harris, Martin Garrix etc. and Finland's own popular artists. Weekend Festival has sold out in advance on both years. In 2013 Weekend Festival was voted as the best summer festival by the listeners of Finnish radio station YleX. In 2015, Weekend Festival expanded to Pärnu, Estonia and in 2016 to Sweden.

 

Festival area

The first Weekend Festival took place in Luukki, Espoo in 2012.[1] Luukki Recreational Area is located 23 km from the centre of Helsinki, Finland. The heart of Luukki, which is one of the most popular outdoor recreation areas in the Helsinki region, is an old manor. The area includes 20 hectares of forest inhabited by flying squirrels.[3] The festival area featured three stages: NRJ Stage, Weekend Stage and Party Stage. There was also a camping area.

 

Following the traffic difficulties in 2012, the festival was moved from the green Luukki forests to a more urban Kyläsaari/Kalasatama Festival area in 2013. The festival area in Kyläsaari/Kalasatama is four metro stops away from the Helsinki Railway Station and also easily reachable on bus, bike or foot. Kalasatama Festival area has hosted in past various bigger concerts and festivals including Sonisphere 2011, Foo Fighters and Green Day.[4] Weekend Festival 2013 had four stages: NRJ Stage, Weekend Stage (tent), Future Stage and Galaxy Stage. Future Stage was located at the Kyläsaari harbour. The festival area in Kyläsaari does not feature a camping ground.

 

In 2015, Weekend Festival Baltic also took place on Pärnu beach, Estonia, with three stages. The last festival in Estonia took place in 2018. On 27.02.2019 the Weekend Festival Baltic OÜ, the organizer of the Estonian festival, was declared bankruptcy.[5]

 

In 2018 the festival moved to Hietaniemi beach and expanded to a 3-day festival.

 

In 2020, due to the corona pandemic, Weekend Festival 2020, planned to Käpylä Sports Park in Helsinki, was canceled.[6]

 

References

  1. ^ Jump up to:a b http://www.discoveringfinland.com/blog/?p=702
  2. ^ http://www.last.fm/festival/3220697+Weekend+Festival
  3. ^ http://www.hel.fi/hki/liv/en/Recreation/Nuuksio/Luukki
  4. ^ https://www.songkick.com/venues/835851-kylasaari
  5. ^ "Weekend Festival läks pankrotti". Äripäev Online. 2019-02-27.
  6. ^ https://www.wknd.fi/en/news/ Weekend canceled. 2020-07-01
  7. ^ http://www.musiikkimedia.fi/fi/industry+awards+gaala/industry+awards+2013+ehdokkaat/
  8. ^ http://ylex.yle.fi/uutiset/popuutiset/tama-oli-kesan-2013-paras-festivaali
  9. ^ http://euvoting.festivalawards.com
